thread.title: Admirals set to open ECHL season Friday
thread.title_full: Admirals set to open ECHL season Friday

title: Admirals set to open ECHL season Friday
text:
Admirals set to open ECHL season Friday Daily Press 
The Norfolk Admirals officially return to the ECHL Friday night with their 7:30 p.m. opener at Scope Arena against the Wheeling Nailers. 
After Norfolk spent 1989-2000 in the ECHL as the Hampton Roads Admirals, winning two titles, the franchise went to the AHL for 15 years — including a Calder Cup title in 2012. 
The ECHL was once an acronym for the East Coast Hockey League, but that no longer applies. The league now goes as far west as Alaska. 
Norfolk returned to the ECHL as part of a chain of events that began with the American Hockey League forming a Western Division, hoping to bring affiliates closer to the NHL’s western squads. 
The franchise that became the Admirals — the Edmonton Oilers’ ECHL affiliate — was 26-38-3-5 as the Bakersfield Condors last season. It was sixth in the seven-team Pacific Division. 
The new Bakersfield Condors are in the AHL, one step above Norfolk in the Oilers’ organization. Last season’s Admirals — the Anaheim Ducks’ AHL affiliate -- are now the San Diego Gulls. 
Of last year’s Bakersfield team, Josh Currie (42 points in 71 games), Jonathan Lessard (41 points in 60 games) and Chase Schaber (33 points in 51 games) are the highest scorers who will begin the year with the Admirals. 
Among goalies, Ty Rimmer (8-11-1-2 with a 3.20 goals-against average) played regularly for Bakersfield and is now an Admiral.
